channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Was Manohara Odelia Pinot, an Indonesian-American model, forced to marry Malaysian prince?
Can Iran’s $7 monthly payment to citizens help end protests over economic crisis?
How the US Capitol is divided 5 years after January 6 riots
Why Trump's plan for Venezuelan oil wealth is slippery
How Venezuela’s Nicolas Maduro became a follower of Indian godman Sathya Sai Baba
Is Japan’s Mirumi the Labubu of 2026?
How Khaleda Zia’s death and Rahman’s return may impact Bangladesh’s polls
item.description: The next general election in Bangladesh is likely to be held on February 12, and until that election takes place, it remains difficult to clearly discern the country’s political trajectory

item.title: The seduction of surgical strikes: Why history should temper today's applause
item.description: The applause surrounding Caracas should be restrained, not amplified. Strategic maturity lies not in celebrating capability, but in understanding its limits

item.title: America retreats, China cornered, Russia relieved: How Trump’s Venezuela raid may hand Bharat an opening
item.description: Donald Trump’s Venezuela raid, intended as a show of force, may instead mark a broader American retreat, reshaping China’s constraints, Russia’s calculations, and Bharat’s options

item.title: How Venezuela is a moment of reckoning for Global South
item.description: For Brics nations and the larger Global South, the US attack on Venezuela is a warning of a coming world where sovereignty will be only rhetoric and multipolarity means hierarchy

item.title: Beyond regime change: Is Iran rewriting its civilisational story?
item.description: The latest season of this ‘Iranian Spring’ began on 28 December 2025, when highly influential merchants of Tehran’s Grand Bazaar revolted against the Iranian rial’s crash, hyperinflation, and a proposed 2026 budget featuring a 62 per cent tax hike.

item.title: India’s semiconductor sector at a turning point: From vision to execution
item.description: India’s semiconductor strategy should be applauded not for its ambition alone, but for its evolving realism, a realism that blends policy focus, industrial pragmatism, ecosystem depth, and relentless execution
